workspace-name.description: A name to describe the entire workspace.

workspace-version.description: A version to give to the entire workspace.

workspace-homepage.description: A homepage URL for the workspace.

workspace-author.description: An individual or business entity involved in creating or maintaining the workspace.

workspace-license.description: A license identifier or text file path that describes how people are permitted or restricted to use this workspace.

workspace-readme.description: A path to the readme file of the workspace.

configuration.description: Properties to describe a single build configuration type.

configuration-debugSymbols.description:
true to include debug symbols, false otherwise.
In GNU-based compilers, this is equivalent to the '-g3' option (-g & macro expansion information) and forces '-O0' if the optimizationLevel is not '0' or 'debug'.
In MSVC, this enables '/debug', '/incremental' and forces '/Od' if the optimizationLevel is not '0' or 'debug'.
This flag is also the determining factor whether the ':debug' suffix is used in a chalet.json property.

configuration-enableProfiling.description:
true to enable profiling for this configuration, false otherwise.
In GNU-based compilers, this is equivalent to the '-pg' option
In MSVC, this adds equivalent options.
If profiling is enabled and the project is run, a compatible profiler application will be launched when the program is run.

configuration-interproceduralOptimizatio.description:
true to use interprocedural optimizations, false otherwise.
In GCC, this enables link-time optimizations - the equivalent to passing the '-flto' & '-fno-fat-lto-objects' options to the compiler, and '-flto' to the linker.
In MSVC, this performs whole program optimizations - the equivalent to passing /GL to cl.exe and /LTCG to link.exe and lib.exe
In Clang, so far, this does nothing.

configuration-optimizationLevel.description:
The optimization level of the build.
In GNU-based compilers, This maps 1:1 with its respective '-O' option, except for 'debug' (-Od) and 'size' (-Os).
In MSVC, it's mapped as follows: 0 (/Od), 1 (/O1), 2 (/O2), 3 (/Ox), size (/Os), fast (/Ot), debug (/Od)
If this value is unset, no optimization level will be used (implying the compiler's default).

configuration-sanitize.description: An array of sanitizers to enable. If combined with staticRuntimeLibrary, the selected sanitizers will be statically linked, if available by the toolchain.

dist-kind.description: Whether the distribution target is a bundle, script, archive, or something platform-specific.

dist-condition.description: A rule describing when to include this target in the distribution.

dist-bundle.description: Properties to describe an individual bundle.

linuxDesktopEntry.description: Properties to describe an XDG Desktop Entry.

template.description: The location to an XDG Desktop Entry template. If the file does not exist, a basic one will be generated in its place.

icon.description: The location to an icon to use with the XDG Desktop Entry (PNG 256x256 is recommended)

macosBundle.description: Properties to describe the MacOS bundle.

type.description: The MacOS bundle type (only .app is supported currently)

icon.description:
The path to a MacOS bundle icon either in PNG or ICNS format.
If the file is a .png, it will get converted to .icns during the bundle process.

infoPropertyList.description: The path to a property list (.plist) file, .json file, or the properties themselves to export as a plist defining the bundle.

dist-bundle-exclude.description:
In folder paths that are included with 'include', exclude certain files or paths.
Can accept a glob pattern.

dist-bundle-include.description:
A list of files or folders to copy into the output directory of the bundle.
In MacOS, these will be placed into the 'Resources' folder of the application bundle.

dist-bundle-mainExecutable.description:
The name of the main executable project target.
If this property is not defined, the first executable in the 'buildTargets' array of the bundle will be chosen as the main executable.

dist-bundle-subdirectory.description: The output folder to place the final build along with all of its included resources and shared libraries.

dist-bundle-buildTargets.description:
Either an array of build target names to include in this bundle. A single string value of '*' will include all build targets.
If 'mainExecutable' is not defined, the first executable target in this list will be chosen as the main exectuable.

dist-bundle-includeDependentSharedLibrar.description: If true (default), any shared libraries that the bundle depeends on will also be copied.

dist-archive.description: Properties to describe an individual distribution archive.

dist-archive-include.description: A list of files or folders to add to the archive, relative to the root distribution directory. Glob patterns are also accepted. A single string value of '*' will archive everything in the bundle directory.

dist-macos-disk-image.description: Properties to describe a macos disk image (dmg). Implies 'condition: macos'

background.description: Either a path to a TIFF, a PNG background image, or paths to 1x/2x PNG background images.

1x.description: The path to a background image in PNG format created for 1x pixel density.

2x.description: The path to a background image in PNG format created for 2x pixel density.

positions.description: The icon positions of paths in the root disk image. Specifying the name of a bundle will include it in the image. Specifying 'Applications' will include a symlink to the '/Applications' path. Additionally, if there is a bundle named 'Applications', it will be ignored, and an error will be displayed.

^[\\w\\-+. ()]{2,}$.description: An icon position in the root disk image.

x.description: The x position of the path's icon

y.description: The x position of the path's icon

size.description: The dimensions of the root of the disk image.

width.description: The width of the disk image

height.description: The height of the disk image

dist-macos-disk-image-pathbarVisible.description: true to display the pathbar (aka breadcrumbs) in the root of the disk image. false to hide it.

dist-macos-disk-image-iconSize.description: The icon size in the root of the disk image.

dist-macos-disk-image-textSize.description: The text size in the root of the disk image.

dist-macos-disk-image-background.description: Either a path to a TIFF, a PNG background image, or paths to 1x/2x PNG background images.

1x.description: The path to a background image in PNG format created for 1x pixel density.

2x.description: The path to a background image in PNG format created for 2x pixel density.

dist-windows-nullsoft-installer.description: Properties to describe an NSIS installer. Implies 'condition: windows'

dist-windows-nullsoft-installer-file.description: Relative path to an NSIS installer script (.nsi) to compile.

dist-windows-nullsoft-installer-pluginDi.description: Relative paths to additional NSIS plugin folders. Can accept a root path that contains standard NSIS plugin path structures like 'Plugins/x86-unicode' and 'x86-unicode'

dist-windows-nullsoft-installer-defines.description: A list of defines to pass to MakeNSIS during the build of the installer.

external-git-repository.description: The url of the git repository.

external-git-branch.description: The branch to checkout. Uses the repository's default if not set.

external-git-commit.description: The SHA1 hash of the commit to checkout.

external-git-tag.description: The tag to checkout on the selected branch. If it's blank or not found, the head of the branch will be checked out.

external-git-submodules.description: Do submodules need to be cloned?

environment-searchPaths.description: Any additional search paths to include. Accepts Chalet variables such as ${buildDir} & ${externalDir}

target-outputDescription.description: A description of the target to display in the build output.

target-kind.description: The type of the target's compiled binary, a script or external project.

target-condition.description: A rule describing when to include this target in the build.

target-defaultRunArguments.description: If the project is the run target, a string of arguments to pass to the run command.

target-copyFilesOnRun.description: If the project is the run target, a list of files that should be copied into the build folder before running. This is primarily meant for libaries that need to be resolved from the same directory as the run target.

target-source-extends.description: A project template to extend. Defaults to '*' implicitly.

target-source-files.description: Define the source files, relative to the working directory.

target-source-language.description: The target language of the project.

target-source-configureFiles.description:
A list of files to copy into an intermediate build folder, and susbstitute variables formatted as either `@VAR` or `${VAR}`. These refer to metadata values at the workspace level or at the source target (project) level. They will be replaced with the variables' value, or an empty string if not recognized. Some backwards compatibility with CMake configure files are supported for convenience.
The variables are:
`WORKSPACE_NAME` `WORKSPACE_DESCRIPTION` `WORKSPACE_AUTHOR` `WORKSPACE_HOMEPAGE_URL` `WORKSPACE_LICENSE` `WORKSPACE_README` `WORKSPACE_VERSION` `WORKSPACE_VERSION_MAJOR` `WORKSPACE_VERSION_MINOR` `WORKSPACE_VERSION_PATCH` `WORKSPACE_VERSION_TWEAK`
`PROJECT_NAME` `PROJECT_DESCRIPTION` `PROJECT_AUTHOR` `PROJECT_HOMEPAGE_URL` `PROJECT_LICENSE` `PROJECT_README` `PROJECT_VERSION` `PROJECT_VERSION_MAJOR` `PROJECT_VERSION_MINOR` `PROJECT_VERSION_PATCH` `PROJECT_VERSION_TWEAK`
`CMAKE_PROJECT_NAME` `CMAKE_PROJECT_DESCRIPTION` `CMAKE_PROJECT_AUTHOR` `CMAKE_PROJECT_HOMEPAGE_URL` `CMAKE_PROJECT_LICENSE` `CMAKE_PROJECT_README` `CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION` `CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_MAJOR` `CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_MINOR` `CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_PATCH` `CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_TWEAK`

`CMAKE_PROJECT_` variables are equivalent to `WORKSPACE_` so using them is a matter of compatibility and preference.

target-source-metadata.description:
Metadata to assign to source targets that can be retrieved with the `PROJECT_` prefix within configure files.
(See: `configureFiles`)

target-source-metadata-name.description: A name to describe the build target.

target-source-metadata-version.description: A version to give to the build target.

target-source-metadata-description.description: A description for the build target.

target-source-metadata-homepage.description: A homepage URL for the build target.

target-source-metadata-author.description: An individual or business entity involved in creating or maintaining the build target.

target-source-metadata-license.description: A license identifier or text file path that describes how people are permitted or restricted to use this build target.

target-source-metadata-readme.description: A path to the readme file of the build target.

target-source-cxx.description:
Settings for compiling C, C++, and Windows resource files.
May also include settings related to linking.

compileOptions.description: Addtional options (per compiler type) to add during the compilation step.

linkerOptions.description: Addtional options (per compiler type) to add during the linking step.

target-source-cxx-cStandard.description: The C standard to use in the compilation

target-source-cxx-cppStandard.description: The C++ standard to use in the compilation

target-source-cxx-defines.description: Macro definitions to be used by the preprocessor

target-source-cxx-includeDirs.description: A list of directories to include with the project.

target-source-cxx-libDirs.description: Fallback search paths to look for static or dynamic libraries (/usr/lib is included by default)

target-source-cxx-linkerScript.description: An LD linker script path (.ld file) to pass to the linker command

target-source-cxx-links.description: A list of dynamic links to use with the linker

target-source-cxx-macosFrameworkPaths.description: A list of paths to search for MacOS Frameworks

target-source-cxx-macosFrameworks.description:
A list of MacOS Frameworks to link to the project.

Note: Only the name of hte framework is necessary (ex: 'Foundation' instead of Foundation.framework)

target-source-cxx-precompiledHeader.description: Compile a header file as a pre-compiled header and include it in compilation of every object file in the project. Define a path relative to the workspace root.

target-source-cxx-threads.description: true to enable the preferred thread implementation of the compiler, such as pthreads (default), false to disable.

target-source-cxx-cppFilesystem.description: true to enable C++17 filesystem, false to disable (default).

target-source-cxx-cppModules.description: true to enable C++20 modules, false to disable (default).

target-source-cxx-cppCoroutines.description: true to enable C++20 coroutines, false to disable (default).

target-source-cxx-cppConcepts.description: true to enable C++20 concepts in previous language standards (equivalent to '-fconcepts' or '-fconcepts-ts'), false to disable (default).

target-source-cxx-runtimeTypeInformation.description: true to include run-time type information (default), false to exclude.

target-source-cxx-fastMath.description: true to enable additional (and potentially dangerous) floating point optimizations (equivalent to '-ffast-math'). false to disable (default).

target-source-cxx-exceptions.description: true to use exceptions (default), false to turn off exceptions.

target-source-cxx-inputCharset.description: The character set used by input source files in this target. Default: UTF-8

target-source-cxx-executionCharset.description: The execution character set to be given to the compiler. Default: UTF-8

target-source-cxx-buildSuffix.description:
Describes a suffix used to differentiate targets within build folders. If the same suffix is used between multiple targets, they can share objects and a precompiled header. By default, the suffix is the name of the target, so setting this to the name of another target will share its objects.
Affected paths:
`${buildOutputDir}/obj.${suffix}`
`${buildOutputDir}/asm.${suffix}`
`${buildDir}/int.${suffix}`

target-source-cxx-staticRuntimeLibrary.description: true to statically link against compiler runtime libraries (libc++, ms-crt, etc.). false to dynamically link them (default).

target-source-cxx-staticLinks.description: A list of static links to use with the linker

target-source-cxx-warnings.description: Either a preset of the warnings to use, or the warnings flags themselves (excluding '-W' prefix)

target-source-cxx-treatWarningsAsErrors.description: true to treat all warnings as errors. false to disable (default).

target-source-cxx-windowsApplicationMani.description: The path to a Windows application manifest, or false to disable automatic generation. Only applies to executable (kind=executable) and shared library (kind=sharedLibrary) targets

target-source-cxx-windowsAppIcon.description: The windows icon to use for the project. Only applies to executable targets (kind=executable)

target-source-cxx-mingwUnixSharedLibrary.description: If true, shared libraries will use the `lib(name).dll` naming convention in the MinGW toolchain (default), false to use `(name).dll`.

target-source-cxx-windowsSubSystem.description: The subsystem to use for the target on Windows systems. If not specified, defaults to 'console'

target-source-cxx-windowsEntryPoint.description: The type of entry point to use for the target on Windows systems. If not specified, defaults to 'main'

target-script-file.description: The relative path to a script file to run.

target-cmake-location.description: The folder path of the root CMakeLists.txt for the project.

target-cmake-buildFile.description: The build file to use, if not CMakeLists.txt, relative to the location. (-C)

target-cmake-defines.description: Macro definitions to be passed into CMake. (-D)

target-cmake-recheck.description: If true, CMake will be invoked each time during the build.

target-cmake-rebuild.description: If true, the CMake build folder will be cleaned and rebuilt when a rebuild is requested.

target-cmake-toolset.description: A toolset to be passed to CMake with the -T option.

target-cmake-runExecutable.description: The path to an executable to run, relative to the build directory.

target-chalet-location.description: The folder path of the root chalet.json for the project.

target-chalet-buildFile.description: The build file to use, if not chalet.json, relative to the location.

target-chalet-recheck.description: If true, Chalet will be invoked each time during the build.

target-chalet-rebuild.description: If true, the Chalet build folder will be cleaned and rebuilt when a rebuild is requested.

target-process-path.description: Either the full path to an exectuable, or a shell compatible name to be resolved.

target-process-arguments.description: A list of arguments to pass along to the process

abstracts.description: A list of abstract build targets

^(\\*|[A-Za-z\\-_]+)$.description: An abstract build target. '*' is a special target that gets implicitely added to each project.

defaultConfigurations.description: An array of allowed default build configuration names.

configurations.description: An object of custom build configurations. If one has the same name as a default build configuration, the default will be replaced.

distribution.description: A sequential list of distribution targets to be created during the bundle phase.

externalDependencies.description: A sequential list of externalDependencies to install prior to building or via the configure command. The key will be the destination directory name for the repository within the folder defined by the command-line option 'externalDir'.

targets.description: A sequential list of build targets, cmake targets, or scripts.

^[\\w\\-+.]{3,}$.description: A single build target or script.

^abstracts:(\\*|[A-Za-z\\-_]+)$.description: An abstract build target. 'abstracts:*' is a special target that gets implicitely added to each project
